text: TYSONS, Va., April 26, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- M.C. Dean announced that it has acquired International Energy Conservation Systems, Inc. (IEC Systems). "IEC is a respected leader in building automation and energy management systems, including expertise in HVAC and lighting controls," said Bill Dean, M.C. Dean chief executive officer. "They will enhance our solution expertise and project delivery for some of our highest-profile controls systems engineering and facilities engineering operations and maintenance customers." IEC Systems is a leading provider of turn-key proprietary and non-proprietary building automation systems and a Distech Controls authorized system integrator. The acquisition includes a newly signed original equipment manufacturer partnership with Distech to expand the firm's direct digital controls (DDC) and building automation systems capabilities. The newly integrated team will join the Automation Systems strategic business unit, which serves as M.C. Dean's center of expertise in industrial, power, energy management, and transit control systems as well as SCADA and networked operational technology. "As the Automation Systems strategic business unit continues to increase our focus on client performance outcomes with respect to facility operations and energy optimization, the addition of IEC Systems and their accretive capability and personnel certifications with proven DDC technology provides M.C. Dean with expanded solution paths for both retrofit and new construction projects," said Bob Link, M.C. Dean vice president of Automation Systems. About M.C. Dean M.C. Dean is Building Intelligence®. We design, build, operate, and maintain cyber-physical solutions for the nation's most recognizable mission-critical facilities, secure environments, complex infrastructure, and global enterprises. The company's capabilities include electrical, electronic security, telecommunications, life safety, automation and controls, audio visual, and IT systems. M.C. Dean is headquartered in Tysons, Virginia and employs more than 5,200 professionals who engineer and deploy automated, secure, and resilient power and technology systems; and deliver the management platforms essential for long-term system sustainability. About International Energy Conservation Systems, Inc. IEC Systems, Inc. is a full-service Independent Systems Integrator of HVAC and Lighting Controls company specializing in government, commercial, industrial, and institutional facilities. The company was incorporated in the State of Georgia in November 1974. Five individuals, four of whom were employees of the IBM Corporation, founded the company. Recent signature projects include support of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, New Carrollton Federal Building, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, and the U.S. Department of the Interior. text: Industry Leading Sustainability Performance in 2021-2022 led to Numerous Awards and Recognition; Winbond on Track to Expand its ESG Leadership in 2023 TAICHUNG, Taiwan, April 26, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- Winbond Electronics Corporation, a leading global supplier of semiconductor memory solutions, today announced the results of its sustainability performance along with aggressive goals and product development plans to expand that leadership in 2023. In addition to its many corporate Environmental Social and Governance (ESG) goals and initiatives, Winbond has also demonstrated its commitment to sustainability through its product development, including flash memory products that support low temperature soldering (LTS) process, space saving techniques used in 100BGA LPDDR4/4X, and advancements in ultra-low power consumption. Winbond Sets Global Sustainability Standard with Sustainability Initiatives and Products Below are just a few of Winbond's sustainability achievements in 2021. To see the full results, go to this webpage. Reduced greenhouse gas emission by 229,245 metric tons of CO 2 e, equal to 505 New York Central Park carbon adsorption per year. e, equal to 505 New York Central Park carbon adsorption per year. Recycled 7,212 metric tons of waste, with recovery rate of 93% Recycled 10.59 million cubic meters of water, and water recycling rate of 83% in Taichung Fab "As one of the leading manufacturers of semiconductor memory products, Winbond is in a unique position to help drive carbon neutrality and slow global warming through its products, technologies and operations," said Winbond. "Sustainability is an issue that needs to be tackled on a global scale and we are proud to set such a strong example driving a greener and more sustainable future." Goals and Objectives Winbond is taking additional actions this year in the following areas to achieve specific goals by 2030 and 2050. Compared to 2021, 90% of electricity using Green Energy in Taichung Fab by 2030 Compared to 2021, carbon emission reduction 60% in Taichung Fab by 2030 Achieve net zero by 2050 Continue to assess and promote new water-saving measures. In cooperation with the government's renewable energy policy, plan and evaluate the viability of renewable energy installation. Introduction of TCFD management framework. Continue to implement new energy-saving measures. Actively cooperate with partners who promote sustainable development issues and will improve and enhance sustainable supplier management, which includes the assessment and document-based and onsite audits of sustainability risks, in the future. Products Designed with Sustainability in Mind One of Winbond's corporate goals is to always design products that support its sustainability efforts. Below are a few examples: LTS Process – Winbond announced that its SON and BGA packages would support a new LTS process that reduces Surface Mount Technology (SMT) temperature from 220-260 o C in the lead-free process to about 190 o C. This new process is enabling Winbond to significantly reduce carbon emissions in SMT production lines, while also simplifying, shortening and lowering the cost of the SMT process. – Winbond announced that its SON and BGA packages would support a new LTS process that reduces Surface Mount Technology (SMT) temperature from 220-260 C in the lead-free process to about 190 C. This new process is enabling Winbond to significantly reduce carbon emissions in SMT production lines, while also simplifying, shortening and lowering the cost of the SMT process. Space Saving Techniques – Winbond announced that its new package 100BGA LPDDR4/4X had achieved the JEDEC JED209-4 standard to ensure energy conservation and carbon reduction. The LPDDR4/4X is now available in a space-saving 100BGA package measuring only 7.5X10mm 2 . The LPDDR4/4X is now available in a space-saving 100BGA package measuring only 7.5X10mm . The device is ideal for IoT applications requiring higher throughput in a small package to allow designers to reduce the PCB size for more compact IoT designs. Ultra-Low Power Consumption – Winbond made several announcements designed to drive ultra-low power consumption in its flash memory products. HYPERRAM ™ – Its ultra-low power, design simplicity and lower pin counts saves space and enables smaller form factors. – Its ultra-low power, design simplicity and lower pin counts saves space and enables smaller form factors. Secure Flash - Winbond is innovating security in memory for more ethical products and more effortless privacy protection in its customers' products. Winbond announced that its TrustME® W77Q Secure Flash Obtains SESIP Level 2 with Physical Attacker Resistance Certification. It certifies that its products provide customers with the most secure and trusted solutions, including W77Q, W75F and W76S. 2022 Awards and Recognition As a result of its sustainability performance over the last year, Winbond received a number of industry awards and accolades. This includes: Certificates, quality, intellectual property patents and green products: Passed ISO50001 energy management system The first company in the world to pass the ISO/SAE 21434 road vehicle network security management system certification Passed the 2022 RBA factory inspection Won two Gold Tower Awards and two Silver Tower Awards in The Taiwan Continuous Improvement Competition; equaling the best results in history Obtained almost 380 patents in 2022; total of over 4,500 patents, worldwide. TrustME ® W77Q secure flash memory won the 2022 OFweek IoT Industry Innovation Technology Product Award and SESIP Level 2 Certification W77Q secure flash memory won the 2022 OFweek IoT Industry Innovation Technology Product Award and SESIP Level 2 Certification HYPERRAM™ 3.0 won the 7th China IoT Innovation Award in 2022 Won the ESG comprehensive evaluation award: Three awards in the 2022 Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Awards (TCSA), including: Corporate Sustainability Report Platinum Award Corporate Sustainability Comprehensive Performance Award - Taiwan Top 100 Sustainability Model Enterprise Award Sustainable Single Performance - Talent Development Leader Award 2022 BSI Sustainability Excellence Award Ranked 6-20% among listed companies in the 8th Corporate Governance Evaluation Selected as a constituent company of Taiwan Stock Exchange Corporate Governance 100 Index and Taiwan High Salary 100 Index Selected as constituent stocks of FTSE4Good FTSE Emerging Market Index and FTSE4Good Taiwan Sustainability Index For more information about 2022 ESG Report, please kindly visit the website. About Winbond Winbond Electronics Corporation is a leading global supplier of semiconductor memory solutions. The Company provides customer-driven memory solutions backed by the expert capabilities of product design, R&D, manufacturing, and sales services. Winbond's product portfolio, consisting of Specialty DRAM, Mobile DRAM, Code Storage Flash, and TrustME® Secure Flash, is widely used by tier-1 customers in communication, consumer electronics, automotive and industrial, and computer peripheral markets. Winbond is headquartered in Central Taiwan Science Park (CTSP), and it has subsidiaries in the USA, Japan, Israel, China, Hong Kong, and Germany. Based on Taichung and Kaohsiung 12-inch fabs in Taiwan, Winbond keeps pace to develop in-house technologies to provide high-quality memory IC products. text: Dublin, April 18, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The "Smart Cities: Global Strategic Business Report" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering. Global Smart Cities Market to Reach $5.2 Trillion by 2030 In the changed post COVID-19 business landscape, the global market for Smart Cities estimated at US$998.7 Billion in the year 2022, is projected to reach a revised size of US$5.2 Trillion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 22.9% over the analysis period 2022-2030. Hardware, one of the segments analyzed in the report, is projected to record a 20.2% CAGR and reach US$2.4 Trillion by the end of the analysis period. Taking into account the ongoing post pandemic recovery, growth in the Software segment is readjusted to a revised 24.2% CAGR for the next 8-year period. The U.S. Market is Estimated at $296.9 Billion, While China is Forecast to Grow at 26% CAGR The Smart Cities market in the U.S. is estimated at US$296.9 Billion in the year 2022. China, the world's second largest economy, is forecast to reach a projected market size of US$823.1 Billion by the year 2030 trailing a CAGR of 26% over the analysis period 2022 to 2030. Among the other noteworthy geographic markets are Japan and Canada, each forecast to grow at 18.3% and 20.9% respectively over the 2022-2030 period. Within Europe, Germany is forecast to grow at approximately 24.6% CAGR. Looking Ahead to 2023 The global economy is at a critical crossroads with a number of interlocking challenges and crises running in parallel. The uncertainty around how Russia`s war on Ukraine will play out this year and the war`s role in creating global instability means that the trouble on the inflation front is not over yet. Food and fuel inflation will remain a persistent economic problem. Higher retail inflation will impact consumer confidence and spending. As governments combat inflation by raising interest rates, new job creation will slowdown and impact economic activity and growth. Lower capital expenditure is in the offing as companies go slow on investments, held back by inflation worries and weaker demand. With slower growth and high inflation, developed markets seem primed to enter into a recession. Fears of new COVID outbreaks and China's already uncertain post-pandemic path poses a real risk of the world experiencing more acute supply chain pain and manufacturing disruptions this year. Volatile financial markets, growing trade tensions, stricter regulatory environment and pressure to mainstream climate change into economic decisions will compound the complexity of challenges faced. Year 2023 is expected to be tough year for most markets, investors and consumers. Nevertheless, there is always opportunity for businesses and their leaders who can chart a path forward with resilience and adaptability. What`s New for 2023? Special coverage on Russia-Ukraine war; global inflation; easing of zero-Covid policy in China and its `bumpy` reopening; supply chain disruptions, global trade tensions; and risk of recession. text: INTRODUCTION The US construction materials industry has grown steadily over the past few years. In 2023, various companies will offer products and services related to building materials. Some of the most popular companies in the US include CertainTeed Corporation, USG Corporation, Armstrong World Industries, Georgia-Pacific Corporation, Weyerhaeuser Company, CEMEX, PPG Industries, and BASF Corporation. CertainTeed Corporation is one of the largest producers of roofing and insulation materials and is based in Pennsylvania. USG Corporation manufactures wallboard and other gypsum and plaster-based building materials and is headquartered in Illinois. Armstrong World Industries produces a range of flooring, ceiling, and wall products and is based in Pennsylvania. Georgia-Pacific Corporation produces timber, building materials, tissue, packaging, and consumer products and is based in Georgia. Weyerhaeuser Company provides lumber, engineered wood products, and other building materials and is headquartered in Washington. CEMEX is a leading cement, concrete, and aggregate producer and is based in Mexico. PPG Industries specializes in paints, coatings, optical products, speciality materials, and fibreglass and is based in Pittsburgh. Finally, BASF Corporation is a major global chemical company with many products used in construction, such as insulation and waterproofing materials, and is based in Germany. IMPORTANCE Construction materials companies in the United States are becoming increasingly important in 2023. As the country’s population grows, more and more homes and businesses will require construction materials. Companies like Home Depot, Lowe’s, Menards, and Ace Hardware are all critical players in this sector. Additionally, new technological advances in construction materials such as steel, aluminium and composite materials will open up new opportunities for these companies. With the increasing demand for green construction materials, sustainable materials such as bamboo and recycled plastic will also become increasingly important. Companies must innovate and stay ahead of the competition to remain successful in this market. For instance, they may need to develop new products that are more cost-effective, durable and efficient. Furthermore, partnerships between these materials companies and architects, builders and contractors will be essential to access emerging markets and tap into new opportunities. As a result, construction materials companies in the United States are highly likely to continue to contribute to the economy and society in a significant way in 2023. Here are the top 10 best construction materials companies in USA in 2023 USG Corporation – USG Corporation is a leading manufacturer of building materials, including ceiling and wall panels, speciality ceilings, flooring systems, and other construction materials for commercial, institutional, and residential applications. Founded in 1902 and headquartered in Chicago, the company has over 50 manufacturing plants in North America and Europe, providing products to more than 40 countries worldwide. USG has a long history of innovation, producing advanced technological solutions for the building industry, such as its revolutionary Sheetrock drywall board and USG Structural Panel Systems. USG’s products are known for their durability, fire resistance, and sound absorption. The company also offers a variety of finishing options and accessories so that customers can customize their projects according to their specific needs. USG is committed to promoting sustainability and environmental responsibility in the construction industry and has received numerous awards for its eco-friendly practices. Its green initiatives range from using renewable or recycled resources to improving energy efficiency and reducing toxic emissions. USG also invests heavily in research and development, regularly introducing new products and technologies that improve safety, performance, and aesthetics. Vulcan Materials Company – Vulcan Materials Company is a leading producer of construction and infrastructure materials. Founded in 1909, the company operates over 350 facilities in the United States and produces aggregates, asphalt, ready-mix concrete and other construction materials. Vulcan Materials Company also produces and markets cement, steel and other building materials. The company has a diverse portfolio of products ranging from sand and gravel to speciality stone and powdered limestone. Vulcan Materials Company offers a range of products for a variety of industries. These include road construction, pavement, landscaping, masonry, asphalt plants, industrial coatings, structural insulation, and residential projects. The company provides technical support and expertise to ensure customers receive the best materials. The company is also committed to sustainability and is one of the most environmentally responsible suppliers of construction materials. Vulcan Materials Company works to reduce its carbon footprint by using recycled materials and investing in energy efficiency initiatives. The company also supports local communities through charitable donations and recycling programs. In addition to its construction materials, Vulcan Materials Company is engaged in the mining and quarrying industry. The company operates over 150 quarries and distributes its products to more than 50 countries worldwide. It also owns and operates several ready-mix concrete plants. Vulcan Materials Company is dedicated to providing superior customer service and is a leader in its industry. The company is always looking for new ways to improve its processes and develop innovative solutions that create value for its customers. Dedicated to safety and environmental responsibility, Vulcan Materials Company is committed to working with its partners to ensure the highest quality and performance standards. CEMEX – Cemex is a Mexican multinational building materials company headquartered in San Pedro Garza García, Monterrey, Mexico. It manufactures and distributes cement, ready-mix concrete and aggregates in more than 50 countries worldwide. It produces, distributes, and sells cement, ready-mix concrete, aggregates, clinker and other construction materials. Cemex is one of the world’s leading suppliers of building materials, with over 80 million tons of aggregates sold in 2018 alone. The company employs over 43,000 people in more than 500 locations worldwide, and its products are used in constructing roads, bridges, towers, airports, hospitals, schools, shopping centres, and many other infrastructure projects. Cemex has also invested in sustainability and renewable energy sources, such as solar power, biofuels and wind energy. The company was founded in 1906 and has been publicly traded since 2001. It is listed on both the Mexican Stock Exchange and the New York Stock Exchange. Martin Marietta Materials – Martin Marietta Materials is an American producer and supplier of aggregates, cement, asphalt and ready-mixed concrete. It is based in Raleigh, North Carolina and is headed by CEO C. Howard Nye. The company produces construction products and materials such as crushed stone, sand, gravel, and asphalt. It operates over 1,500 quarries, mines, plants and distribution facilities in the United States and Canada. Martin Marietta serves contractors, government agencies, and other businesses in the construction industry. Martin Marietta has a long history dating back to the 1930s when it began as the Martin Marietta Corporation. By the mid-1960s, the company had diversified into multiple industries, including defence, aerospace, energy, and chemicals. In 1997, Martin Marietta merged with Lockheed Corporation to form Lockheed Martin, the largest U.S. defence contractor. In 2014, Martin Marietta spun off from Lockheed Martin and became an independent, publicly traded company. Today, Martin Marietta employs more than 8,000 people across its operations, which are located in 44 states, the District of Columbia and Canada. In 2019, the company reported $3.9 billion in sales and revenues. Its products are used in various applications, such as roadway repair and maintenance, bridge construction, airports and other infrastructure projects. Martin Marietta also produces ready-mix concrete for residential and commercial construction projects. In addition to its core construction business, Martin Marietta also provides environmental services to customers in the energy industry. This includes design, engineering, and construction services for the remediation and closure of former mining and industrial sites. Martin Marietta’s commitment to safety, sustainability, and customer service has made it a leader in its industry. The company prides itself on maintaining a safe and healthy workplace, reducing its environmental footprint, and providing quality construction materials and services. CRH plc – CRH PLC is a globally diversified building materials group that produces and distributes innovative products for the construction sector. The company manufactures and supplies a wide range of products, including asphalt, aggregates, cement, ready-mix concrete, precast concrete and precast components, doors, windows, roof tiles, clay bricks, blocks, mortar, insulation and roofing. With manufacturing operations in 36 countries across four continents and sales in over 100, CRH PLC has a strong presence in Europe, North America, South America and Asia Pacific. The company’s portfolio of businesses serves customers in both the commercial and residential sectors. CRH PLC operates through three main divisions: Americas Materials, Europe Materials and Distribution. Americas Materials produces and supplies construction products to customers throughout the United States, Canada and Latin America. Europe Materials is responsible for producing and supplying construction materials to UK, Ireland, Germany, France and Iberia customers. The Distribution division provides construction materials from its warehousing, packaging and logistics operations. The company’s commitment to innovation and sustainability is reflected in its investments in research and development, energy efficiency and environmental protection. CRH PLC is dedicated to remaining at the forefront of construction technology and helping build more sustainable infrastructure. CRH PLC has a long history of delivering exceptional value for its shareholders and consistently delivering attractive returns. Summit Materials – Summit Materials Company is a leading provider of construction materials and services to North America’s infrastructure, commercial and residential markets. With over 250 locations across the United States and Canada, Summit has more than 4,000 workers. It provides various products and services, including aggregates, asphalt, ready-mix concrete, paving and construction services. Summit is committed to providing quality products and services to meet customer needs and exceed expectations. The company prides itself on being a responsible corporate citizen, taking proactive steps to protect the environment, being dedicated to safety, investing in communities and providing opportunities for learning and growth for its team members. Summit’s core values are innovation, integrity, teamwork and customer focus. They strive to consistently deliver superior value to their customers through a commitment to excellence in every aspect of their business. Their portfolio of products and services includes innovative technology, safety training, sustainable building practices, and environmental compliance. Summit’s sustainability initiatives include reducing carbon emissions, conserving energy and water, and utilizing recycled materials. They are also committed to providing safe working conditions, protecting the health and safety of their employees, and providing equal opportunity in employment. As a leader in the industry, Summit Materials Company is dedicated to providing quality products and services with a commitment to excellence, building long-term relationships with customers, and creating lasting value. HeidelbergCement Group – HeidelbergCement Group is a leading global building materials company headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany. The company produces cement, aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, and asphalt and has operations in over 60 countries worldwide. It is one of the world’s largest cement producers, making up 12% of the global market share. The company employed over 59,000 people and had a total turnover of €17.1 billion in 2018. The company traces its roots back to 1874 when Johann Philip Schmidt established it as a family business. The company increased in size and scope through several acquisitions and expansions in the twentieth century. Today, HeidelbergCement is active in Europe, Asia, North America, South America, Africa, and Australia. It is the largest producer of construction materials in Germany and the second largest in Europe. HeidelbergCement is committed to sustainability and environmental stewardship. It has set ambitious goals to reduce carbon dioxide emissions by 20% by 2030 and 50% by 2050. It is also committed to responsible management of natural resources, including a commitment to zero deforestation for raw materials used in its products. The company has invested in numerous renewable energy projects to support these efforts, with plans to invest more in the future. In addition, it strives to ensure that all of its products meet the highest quality and safety standards. Granite Construction – Granite Construction Company is a leading engineering and construction firm in the United States. It is headquartered in Watsonville, California and operates regional offices in over 20 states nationwide. With over 10,000 employees and more than $3 billion in annual revenue, Granite has been providing a wide range of services since 1922. Granite offers construction services such as highway and bridge, rail infrastructure, site development, water and wastewater systems, airports, and other civil works projects. It also provides environmental remediation, energy and natural gas services, and asphalt paving. Granite is one of the country’s largest and most respected engineering and construction firms. Its projects are notable for their high quality and innovative design. Granite has completed many significant and complex projects, including the San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge and the Hoover Dam Bypass Bridge. The firm is dedicated to sustainability and is a leader in green building practices. Granite strives to use renewable materials, reduce waste, conserve resources, and create safe and efficient buildings. Granite’s commitment to safety is exemplified by its excellence in accident prevention, focusing on minimizing risks, preventing injuries and illnesses, and protecting workers and the public. The company has an excellent record of safety and health performance, earning numerous industry awards. Granite is committed to creating value for its shareholders, customers, and business partners through its mission and values. These include integrity, innovation, collaboration, and excellence. By consistently providing quality services and delivering successful projects, Granite has become a leader in the construction industry. Oldcastle Materials – Oldcastle Materials Company is a leading supplier of construction and building materials in the United States. Founded in 1920, they are a subsidiary of CRH plc, a global leader in building materials. Oldcastle Materials Company is headquartered in Atlanta, GA and has more than 200 locations nationwide. Their products include various construction and building materials such as asphalt, aggregates, ready mix concrete, block and brick, roofing and siding, mortar, stone, sand and gravel, and more. They also offer specialized services like delivery, paving, traffic control, erosion control, site planning and design, landscape installation, and maintenance. Oldcastle Materials Company is committed to providing quality products and services that meet customer needs while maintaining environmental sustainability. They are dedicated to creating a safe work environment and taking action to reduce their impact on the environment. Oldcastle Materials Company values innovation, safety, and customer service and strives to remain at the forefront of the industry. Eagle Materials Inc. – Eagle Materials Inc. is a leading American building materials business that manufactures and distributes cement, gypsum wallboard, recycled paperboard, concrete and aggregates across the United States. Founded in 1963, Eagle Materials is a publicly-traded company (NYSE: EXP) with a market capitalization of over $4 billion. The company operates 30 plants in 25 states and employs approximately 4,000 people generating an annual revenue of $2.3 billion. Through its subsidiaries, Eagle Materials produces cement primarily for ready-mix and precast concrete products, as well as for steel, agricultural, oil and gas and mining customers. It also manufactures and distributes gypsum wallboard and recycled paperboard to drywall, construction and packaging markets. Additionally, the company produces and supplies lightweight aggregates, fly ash and natural pozzolanic materials, and concrete and masonry products, at various locations throughout the US. Eagle Materials is dedicated to sustainability and environmental stewardship, with its operations adhering to the highest standards set by the US EPA and other local and state environmental protection agencies. The company works diligently to maintain best practices regarding air and water quality, land resources, and energy conservation. They also strive to reduce waste and comply with all applicable laws and regulations. Eagle Materials is committed to being a responsible corporate citizen and contributing to the communities in which they operate. They invest in public education initiatives and community projects to support their employees and neighbours. Eagle Materials has experienced consistent growth and profitability thanks to its diversified product portfolio, strong customer relationships and commitment to innovation. They continue to focus on expanding their existing operations and investing in new technologies. With the vision to be the premier North American building materials firm, Eagle Materials is setting the standard for excellence in its industry. CONCLUSION In 2023, construction materials companies in the US saw a steady increase in profits due to an increased demand for new buildings and infrastructure. Many of the largest companies are now focusing on sustainability, with many offering recycled products and innovative manufacturing processes. Additionally, there has been a push for green buildings and eco-friendly materials, leading companies to invest in research and development to create more efficient and sustainable products. Overall, the future of construction materials companies in the US looks bright, as the industry is predicted to continue to grow.

text: INTRODUCTION Dairy farming has been an essential part of the U.S. agricultural economy for centuries, and in 2023 the industry is poised for continued growth. The United States is a major producer of dairy products, with total milk production estimated to reach over 200 billion pounds from over 9.2 million dairy cows nationwide. Dairy farmers use various techniques and technologies to raise healthy, productive cows, including robotic milking systems, improved feed rations, and precision agriculture. In the U.S., most dairy farms are concentrated in states like California, Wisconsin, Minnesota, New York, Pennsylvania, and Idaho. These states produce most of the country’s milk, cheese, butter, and other dairy products. The U.S. also ranks highly in global dairy exports, with approximately 8% of all international dairy exports originating in the U.S. The American dairy industry is highly regulated and requires farmers to adhere to strict standards. All producers must register with the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and comply with state and federal regulations regarding animal welfare, food safety, and environmental stewardship. This helps ensure that products produced by U.S. dairy farmers are of the highest quality. In addition to traditional farms, the dairy industry also includes dairy processing facilities, which are responsible for the manufacturing and packaging dairy products. Dairy processors have invested in modernizing their operations, including the purchase of new equipment and technology. This ensures that products remain fresh and safe for consumers. Overall, the U.S. dairy industry is expected to continue its strong performance in 2023 as it enjoys a sustained level of consumer demand and ongoing technological advances. IMPORTANCE Dairy farming is a vital industry in the United States and will remain so in 2023. Regarding economic importance, dairy farming contributes significantly to the economy through job creation, income generation, and export opportunities. Specifically, the U.S. dairy industry employed over 800,000 people in 2017 and generated $39 billion in revenue, with exports totalling $5.6 billion. In addition, the U.S. dairy sector influences agricultural research, technology advancements, and overall national food security. The U.S. dairy sector produces more than 200 million metric tons of milk and over 6 million metric tons of cheese annually. As of 2018, the US was the fourth largest milk producer, behind India, China, and the E.U. In addition, the dairy industry is responsible for providing nutrition to millions of Americans each year; according to the USDA, 49 per cent of American children aged 2-19 consume milk daily. The U.S. dairy industry faces several challenges in the coming years, including a changing climate, rising production costs, and increased competition from other countries. To combat these issues, dairy farmers must focus on improving efficiency and productivity, using new technologies such as precision agriculture, robotic milking systems, and automated feeding systems. Additionally, farmers must continue to promote the health benefits of dairy products and work to develop innovative products to meet consumer needs. Overall, dairy farming remains a significant and growing sector of the U.S. economy, contributing to job growth, income generation, and food security nationwide. With continued efforts to increase efficiency and productivity and promote the health benefits of dairy products, the U.S. dairy industry can continue to be a vital contributor to the U.S. economy in 2023 and beyond. Here are the top 10 best dairy farming companies in USA in 2023 Land O’ Lakes – Land O’ Lakes is a United States agribusiness and food cooperative that produces butter, cheese, dairy products, and other foods. Founded in 1921 by a group of Minnesota dairy farmers, the company has become one of the largest cooperatives in the United States, with over 3,600 members producing more than 14 billion pounds of milk each year. Land O’ Lakes is known for its iconic butter packaging, featuring a Native American woman in a headdress designed in 1928 and used for nearly a century. The company also produces sour cream, cottage cheese, cream cheese, yoghurt, ice cream, and other dairy products. In addition to dairy products, Land O’ Lakes produces animal feed, pet food, frozen meals, and other food items. The company takes pride in their commitment to sustainability, sourcing ingredients from local farms and investing in renewable energy sources. They have also developed a unique grass-fed program in which cows graze on grasses specifically chosen to provide healthier nutrients to their milk. Land O’ Lakes’ products can be found in stores throughout the United States and in a growing number of countries worldwide. Their mission is to provide great-tasting, high-quality products that meet the needs of their customers. Cargill Dairy Solutions – Cargill Dairy Solutions is a global leader in dairy and food ingredients, producing quality products that meet the needs of customers across the world. They source milk from farms in over 30 countries and have invested in leading-edge technology to create innovative, high-quality nutrition solutions. Cargill has been in business for more than 150 years, with a long commitment to innovative product development and customer satisfaction. Their dairy ingredients and products portfolio includes fluid milk products, cheese and whey proteins, ice cream, cultured products and butter. Their innovative dairy ingredients include speciality cheeses, dry ingredients, and desserts. The company strongly focuses on safety, quality, sustainability and traceability. All their products are subject to stringent quality assurance tests and are certified by ISO 9001 and HACCP standards, and this ensures that customers enjoy consistent and safe products every time. Cargill Dairy Solutions works hard to reduce waste and improve efficiency throughout production. This includes using advanced technologies such as automated processes and robotic milking to maximize output, manage data, and ensure quality control. They also invest heavily in research and development to continuously develop new products and technologies that help customers achieve better results. Through their commitment to innovation, they have earned numerous awards and recognition for their contributions to the industry. Cargill Dairy Solutions is committed to providing excellent service and environmentally responsible products. They are committed to meeting the changing needs of their customers while ensuring that the natural environment remains healthy and protected. As such, they strive to use sustainable practices, including reducing energy consumption, preserving biodiversity and protecting water resources. Dean Foods – Dean Foods is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the United States. Founded in 1925, the company is based in Dallas, Texas and operates more than 50 plants across the country. It produces a wide range of products, including dairy and non-dairy beverages, ice cream, creamers, cultured dairy products, juices, teas, bottled water, and other food items. Dean Foods offers its products through various channels, including grocery stores, food service distributors, and e-commerce outlets. In addition to its brands, the company distributes products from well-known brands, such as International Delight, Silk, Reddi-Wip, Land O’Lakes, and Breyers. Over the years, Dean Foods has become an essential part of the American food industry, providing consumers with high-quality dairy and other food and beverage products. In 2020, Dean Foods underwent a dramatic restructuring process, resulting in selling of 60 of its manufacturing facilities and losing approximately 3,000 jobs. Despite these difficult times, the company remains committed to its mission of providing quality products to customers and ensuring that its employees are cared for. In the future, Dean Foods plans to focus on increasing efficiency, creating value for its customers, and developing innovative products and strategies. With a solid commitment to innovation, Dean Foods is well-positioned to continue leading the industry. DFA (Dairy Farmers of America) – Dairy Farmers of America (DFA) is a national, member-owned cooperative of more than 13,000 dairy farm families that helps provide quality dairy products and services to customers worldwide. Established in 1998, DFA operates more than 100 local, regional and national businesses in the United States, Mexico and Canada. The cooperative’s mission is to build strong dairy communities by providing members access to resources, expertise, and support. DFA provides members with a wide range of services, such as milk quality testing and monitoring, feed purchasing, herd health management, and marketing of dairy products. The cooperative also provides technical expertise and educational resources to help members maximize their profits and protect the environment. Additionally, DFA offers cooperative business insurance programs, financial planning services and retirement options. DFA promotes sustainability through conservation efforts and environmental stewardship to ensure the long-term success of its members and the industry. The company also works with universities and other organizations to research new technologies, practices and processes to improve and enhance dairy production. DFA works hard to develop and maintain strong relationships with its customers, members, employees and the government. The cooperative is committed to providing quality products and services that meet both consumer needs and producer expectations. AMPI (Associated Milk Producers Inc.) – Associated Milk Producers Inc. (AMPI) is a member-owned dairy industry cooperative and one of the largest dairy cooperatives in the United States. Founded in 1940, AMPI has grown from a small local farmers’ organization to an international cooperation with more than 2,400 members in 10 states. The company processes more than 6 billion pounds of milk annually and is the leading producer of cheese and other dairy products in the Upper Midwest. AMPI’s success is built upon its strong commitment to providing its members with reliable, high-quality products and services. The company offers a complete line of dairy products, including butter, cheese, cream and whey products, food ingredients and bulk ice cream mix. Through its membership, AMPI provides access to an extensive national distribution network and a wide range of innovative marketing programs and services. In addition to providing quality dairy products, AMPI invests heavily in research and development to ensure that its products remain competitive in the marketplace. The company invests in research and development to determine new ways to formulate products and improve product safety and quality standards. This investment also helps to maintain its market leadership position in the dairy industry. AMPI’s commitment to its members includes providing the most comprehensive and up-to-date technological solutions. They have embraced advanced technology to improve efficiency and performance, such as its online Milk Processor Tracking System, which allows members to monitor their delivery and inventory levels. Additionally, AMPI provides a secure web portal for members to access data and resources. AMPI is also committed to its role as a responsible corporate citizen. The company actively supports charitable causes throughout the U.S., helping to provide nutrition and health education to children, supporting sustainable farming practices, promoting environmental awareness, and much more. Overall, AMPI is a leading example of an innovative and successful dairy cooperative committed to the success of its members, customers, and the communities in which it operates. Saputo Dairy Products USA – Saputo Dairy Products USA is an American subsidiary of Saputo, Inc., one of the largest dairy processors in the world. Saputo USA manufactures, distributes and markets a wide variety of high-quality dairy products from its production facilities across the United States. Saputo USA produces and sells dairy products such as cheese, butter, yoghurt, ice cream, sour cream, cream cheese, cottage cheese, whipping cream, half and half, whipped cream, and condensed milk. In addition to its brands, Saputo USA manufactures and distributes products for other companies in the dairy industry, including Domino’s Pizza, Yoplait, Kraft, Dannon, and Chobani. The company also operates in Canada, Argentina, Brazil, and Uruguay. Saputo USA has grown significantly since its inception, expanding into new markets and offering more than 600 dairy products. The company prides itself on producing quality, healthy dairy products with a focus on sustainability. Saputo USA works with local farmers and partners with their suppliers to ensure they provide only the highest quality milk while adhering to strict safety protocols. Additionally, Saputo USA has implemented its traceability technology, allowing them to track its milk supply throughout the entire process. The company is also committed to reducing its environmental footprint by using renewable energy sources, reducing water usage and investing in green technologies. Saputo USA is dedicated to providing excellent customer service and creating innovative solutions for its customers. This includes product customization, private labelling, creative design for packaging, and customized distribution channels. Saputo USA strives to be a leader in the dairy industry by promoting a culture of innovation and collaboration with its partners and customers. California Dairies, Inc. – California Dairies, Inc. is a leading manufacturer of dairy products and cheese. The company was founded in 1921 and has grown to become the largest dairy cooperative in the United States. The headquarters are in California, with production facilities throughout the U.S., Mexico, and Europe. California Dairies produces many popular brands of milk, butter, yoghurt, ice cream, cheese, and other dairy products. Their products are available in grocery stores, supermarkets, and convenience stores. The company utilizes cutting-edge technology and modern equipment to produce high-quality products. They take pride in maintaining the highest safety and quality standards while producing products that meet consumer demands. California Dairies strives to use sustainable and energy-efficient technologies to reduce environmental impact. The cooperative is owned and controlled by its members, who are California dairy farmers. The members work together to ensure the success and sustainability of the cooperative. All members share profits, and dividends are paid out annually. The company is committed to providing excellent customer service and helping consumers make informed decisions when purchasing dairy products. A team of experts is on hand to provide guidance and answer questions about product ingredients, nutrition, and food safety. California Dairies also offers a variety of educational resources, including recipes and health tips. The company actively supports local communities and charitable causes through donations and volunteer efforts. California Dairies is dedicated to providing fresh, safe, and nutritious dairy products to benefit its customers and communities. HP Hood LLC – HP Hood LLC is a leading supplier of dairy and other food products in the United States. The Hood family has owned the company since its inception in 1846 and today operates as part of the HP Hood Dairy Group, wholly owned by the French dairy cooperative Lactalis International. HP Hood LLC produces more than 200 varieties of milk, cream, juices, ice cream, cottage cheese, sour cream, eggnog, and other products. Their portfolio also includes well-known brands such as Hood, Heluva Good!, and LACTAID. HP Hood LLC employs more than 5,000 people across eight plants in the northeastern United States, and their products are available in all 50 states. HP Hood LLC is dedicated to providing high-quality, affordable products to consumers. They strive to create innovative recipes that combine the best ingredients with unique flavours, offering products that meet the needs of both traditional and health-conscious customers. HP Hood LLC is committed to sustainability and environmental stewardship and is a leader in reducing its carbon footprint. The company implements waste reduction, energy conservation, and efficient water management practices. HP Hood LLC also supports local communities through volunteerism, environmental education, and corporate philanthropy. Hilmar Cheese Company – Hilmar Cheese Company is a family-owned and operated cheese producer in Hilmar, California. Founded in 1984, the company has been making quality cheese products for over 35 years. Their speciality cheeses are made with natural ingredients and crafted to perfection. Hilmar Cheese Company provides a diverse selection of cheese varieties that include traditional cheddar, Monterey Jack, and Colby, as well as other innovative flavours like Gouda, Provolone, and Feta. They also offer an array of speciality cheeses such as their award-winning Cave-aged Cheddar, Habanero White Cheddar, and their signature Hilmar Blue cheese. In addition to its cheese products, Hilmar Cheese Company also offers a variety of related dairy products, including cream cheese spreads, sour cream, butter, and yoghurt. Their commitment to quality is evident in their standards and processes. Hilmar Cheese Company believes in using sustainable practices and using milk from local family farms to ensure the best product possible. All of their cheese production is done by hand, and they use state-of-the-art equipment to control temperature and humidity. As a result, their cheeses are consistent, flavorful, and of superior quality. The company also prides itself on providing exceptional customer service and quick delivery. Hilmar Cheese Company is passionate about producing artisanal cheese products and supporting local farmers. They have earned a reputation as one of the leading producers of cheese in the United States. With its commitment to quality, sustainability, and excellent customer service, Hilmar Cheese Company is sure to continue delighting customers for many years to come. Prairie Farms Dairy – Prairie Farms Dairy Company is a family-owned and operated dairy cooperative based in Carlinville, Illinois. Founded in 1937, Prairie Farms is one of the largest dairy cooperatives in the United States and produces over one billion gallons of milk each year. The company employs over 5,500 people, has more than 900 member farms and operates over 60 processing plants across 16 states. Prairie Farms products include a wide range of fluid kinds of milk, creamers, juices, cheese, ice cream, yoghurt and speciality items. Through its co-op members, the company also provides organic, non-GMO, lactose-free and regular dairy options. Prairie Farms sources its milk from hundreds of small, family-owned farms located in the Midwest region, where cows are raised on grass-fed diets and treated with the utmost respect and care. In addition to providing safe and nutritious dairy products, Prairie Farms also promotes sustainability through its conservation efforts and renewable energy initiatives. Together, Prairie Farms’ efforts have made it one of the most trusted names in the dairy industry. CONCLUSION In 2023, dairy farming companies in the USA are expected to continue to grow and expand. The industry has seen a steady increase in the number of farms and producers over the past decade, and this trend is expected to continue. As a result, dairy products are likely to remain widely available and popular. Consumers can expect to see an increase in new types of products, as well as more organic, sustainable, and humane production methods. Overall, the future of dairy farming looks bright in the USA, with continued growth and innovation leading to higher-quality products for consumers.
